byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington, and Josh Kron from Nairobi.

abstract: Kenyan government reveals that its extensive military foray into Somalia to battle Islamist militants was not simply a response to a wave of kidnappings, as it had claimed, but was actually planned in advance as part of a covert strategy to penetrate Somalia and keep the violence there from spilling over the border.
snippet: The Kenyan government revealed that its foray against Islamist militants was not simply a response to a wave of kidnappings, as previously claimed.
lead_paragraph: The Kenyan government revealed that its foray against Islamist militants was not simply a response to a wave of kidnappings, as previously claimed.

headline.main: Kenyan Motives in Somalia Predate Recent Abductions
headline.print_headline: Kenyan Motives in Somalia Predate Recent Abductions
